intro: Eutacta cookii var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender eutacta, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
